mane. At 13, I was content to accept what he told me, simply on his authority.
Then, at 16, I read those Articles of Religion, carefully and critically for the
first time. I was disturbed that my church accepted predestination. Before the
foundation of the world, the Articles said, God had chosen some vessels for
honor and others for dishonor.*One of the first principles of my church was
that no one should be required to believe, as necessary for salvation, any doc-
